text:
10/10 for the food! Ordered Mango Tango with Poached egg (additional $1.50), really flavourful and umaminess was really good!

Update 17.1.24:
Ordered the Moo Ragu with additional egg, the sauce was really flavourful and I love how the penne was cooked al dente because it isn’t soggy by the time I reach home to consume it. The cherry tomatoes had a wokhei and the sauce was thick, flavourful and reminded me a little of aglio olio dressing. 10/10 would recommend

I mean it was not bad, ordered a custom made, the big prawns were even torched after which was quite cool, but their pappardelle was slightly under, and I mean under Al dente, and now I know what combos will be good:
1) Creamed Salmon and Onsen Egg and Tobiko
2) Aglio Oglio with Scallops and Prawns

I will definitely be back to try again with the Spaghetti options

For the price the pasta probably can even beat some of the restaurants in town. Texture of the pasta was al dente. I had pesto besto and the flavours were just right. Combined with the salmon and sous vide egg, it was a balanced meal.

Googled (as usual) for nice food at Bugis junction and decided to try this as I love pasta. The beetroot pasta was thick and chewy, though like other reviewers mentioned it was a bit too tough to eat so I ended up steaming it to soften. Aglio olio base was quite tasty. They could be more generous w the salmon pieces though - felt that it wasn’t a lot compared to the photos in other reviews. All in all, not bad and I’ll try it w the other main/protein ingredients (e.g. chicken breast/prawn) the next time. Hopefully those are better portioned and more filling!

Spaghetti Meet Balls, or chicken meatball pasta, was packed with sauce separately which was great. Pasta was fresh and three meatballs were big and juicy. I quite enjoyed it — but I got really thirsty after (needed five cups of water) so it could contain lots of salt or MSG.

Trufflin’ Cool — cold pasta with truffle oil, tiny scallops, shio kombu and ebiko — was flavourful and crunchy with the ebiko. Didn’t get thirsty after this.
